result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Allen James Gross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus Allen James Gross is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus Allen James Gross was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Marcus Allen James Gross was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 4.
Defendant to report to Probation today June 14, 2016.
Court will not object to early termination of Probation if conditions are met early and Agent requests termination.
Court notes 2 days credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF248.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF248.
Balance of $120.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #15CF248.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Random and regular testing.
-Domestic Violence Assessment.
-Comply with all treatment made by Mr. Solsvig regarding outpatient treatment.
-Maintain employment.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with H. Kralewski.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
-Sentence to commence no later than August 5, 2016 and to be served in incraments of 5 days. 
-The first 5 days to be served within the first 6 months of Probation. 
-The balance of 5 days to be served during the second half of Probation.
-Huber granted for employment and child care.

supervisions.notes:

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Marcus Allen James Gross appeared. Case called at 8:35. Court reviews file. Court receives letter from the drug abuse counselor.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  The plea was to count 2 and 3 as amended WITHOUT THE DOMESTIC ABUSE COMPONENT. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence I/S
8 months St. Croix County Jail STAYED.
18 months probation with conditions:
Ct. 2
- 10 days st. Croix County Jail to commence not later than Aug. 5
   to be served in incraments of 5 days to be served in the first 6 months of probation and the
   other 5 to be served the second half of probation.  
   Huber granted for employment and child care
      credit for 2 days against any ultimate sentence
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
   Apply bond on file. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing. 
- AODA and any other recommended treatement. 
- Domestic violence assessment. 
- Comply with treatment made by Mr. Solsvig regarding outpatient treatment.
- maintain employment
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, H. Kralewski.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  

Ct. 3 
60 days St. Croix County Jail
consecutive to Ct. 2
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Court will not object to early termination of probation if conditions are met early and agent requests termination.

signed by def.
Sentencing hearing at 03-22-2016 08:00 am

** AMENDED**

__ SIGNATURE BOND:   
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $500.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Heather K. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF:  Marcus Allen James Gross appeared. Case called at 8:14. ADA Nieskes updates the court and requests sentencing to be put off for now so DE can obtain his assessment. Atty. Smestad agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 and 3  in 15CF248. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 3  in 15CF248. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 and 4 in 15CF248. Sentencing arguments. DE needs to complete an assessment before sentencing. Court would like something in writing from DE father freeing up some of the bond money to send to the health center for the assessment. Court would amend to $150 cash and $500 signature bond when letter is recieved. DE is now living with his dad in Deer Park but has his mail sent to address on file.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Plea hearing at 01-21-2016 08:00 am
Jury trial at 01-21-2016 08:00 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad for today. DF:  Marcus Allen James Gross appeared. Case called at 1: 32. Court reviews file. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court files the Information. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading.  NG entered on all counts.  Waives speedy trial. DE to go to the commissioners office to get paperwork to address placement. Victim Witness will notify the mother. State to provide discovery in 20 days, motions within 10 days from that. Address of Deer Park is physical address. Balsam Lake is mailing address.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Heather K. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
